medical_history.chief_complaint: Proximal muscle weakness from early childhood.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced motor development delay, holding her head from 7 months, sitting from 16 months, and walking from 21 months of age. She required support to stand up. In early childhood, mouth was slightly open. Condition worsened in recent years with marked gait disturbances, difficulties climbing stairs, and inability to rise from the floor by herself.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hospitalized with pneumonia due to aspiration on the third day of life, requiring mechanical ventilation until 4.5 months of age. No history of seizures. Vision and hearing are preserved.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the second child of healthy nonconsanguineous Russian parents. Genetic analysis confirmed that each parent is a carrier of one variant.
